Package com.ibm.streams.operator.samples.operators

Class Regex

java.lang.Object
com.ibm.streams.operator.AbstractOperator
com.ibm.streams.operator.samples.patterns.TupleInTupleOut
com.ibm.streams.operator.samples.operators.Regex
All Implemented Interfaces:
Operator
@PrimitiveOperator(name="RegexFilter", description="Sample operator that using regular expressions to filter tuples.", comment=" Licensed Materials - Property of IBM (C) Copyright Teracloud ApS 2024, 2024, IBM Corp. 2010, 2016 All Rights Reserved. US Government Users Restricted Rights - Use, duplication or disclosure restricted by GSA ADP Schedule Contract with IBM Corp. ") @InputPorts(@InputPortSet(cardinality=1)) public class Regex extends TupleInTupleOut
Sample operator that using regular expressions to filter tuples. This class extends the pattern class TupleInTupleOut to implement a functor like behavior when a tuple is output if it matches any regular expression.

A set of regular expression patterns is set by the parameter patterns. The operator uses the matching capability provided by the standard Java package java.util.regex.

A tuple matches if any of its ustring attributes match any of the provided patterns. If a tuple matches then an output tuple will be generated with its attributes set from the input using OutputTuple.assign(Tuple).

This operator provided as the sample Java primitive operator
com.ibm.streams.javaprimitivesamples.operators.RegexFilter
in the sample JavaOperators toolkit located in:
$STREAMS_INSTALL/samples/spl/feature/JavaOperators

See Also:

    • setPatterns

      @Parameter(description="Set the regular expression patterns used to filter tuples.") public void setPatterns(List<String> patterns)
      Set the patterns used to filter tuples. The parameter patterns sets the regular expressions to match the incoming tuple against.
      Parameters:
      patterns - Regular expression patterns to be used to filter tuples.

    • filter

      protected boolean filter(StreamingInput<Tuple> inputStream, Tuple tuple)
      Execute the regular expressions against any ustring in the incoming tuple. If any match exists true is returned to indicate an outgoing tuple is to be sent using the transform method.
      Overrides:
      filter in class TupleInTupleOut
      Returns:
      True to continue processing this tuple and call transform, false to stop processing this tuple and do not send any output tuples.

    • transform

      protected boolean transform(StreamingInput<Tuple> inputStream, Tuple tuple, OutputTuple outTuple) throws Exception
      Simply assign the input tuple to the output tuple which will copy across the values for any matching Attributes, regardless of position in the StreamSchema.
      Specified by:
      transform in class TupleInTupleOut
      tuple - Incoming tuple.
      outTuple - An empty tuple.
      Returns:
      True to send outTuple, false to not send the tuple.
      Throws:
      Exception
